result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Caughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF178, 14CF202 & 14CF332 called together at 10:41 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert W. Buckett. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CF332, Ct#1-14CF202 & Ct#1-14CF178; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining Counts in each case

On Count #1-14CF178, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:
On Count #1-14CF202, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to 14CF178 and any other and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions: 
On Count #1-14CF332, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 9 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to 14CF178 & 14CF202 and any other previously imposed sentence, and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions: 
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (on Ct#1-14CF1478) to fo to Veteran's Affairs Office in the Jefferson County Courthouse to inquire about treatment options & to go to Tyson to apply for employment & if hired, may start work immediately; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Enroll in and complete a course of therapy/treatment in Anger Management
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No direct or indirect contact with Tanya Wolf
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No acts/threats of violence 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Subject to random drug & alcohol testing at the discretion of Agent
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender, except as approved by Agent
--To pay costs of $
804 ($268 each count)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CF178)
--To pay $750 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
-14CF178 (5/24-5/27/14)
Days credit for time already served: 3 days-14CF202 (6/8-6/11/14)
Days credit for time already served: 43 days-14CF332 (9/18-10/30/14)

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court orders Mr. Caughlin to report to Probation within 24 hours of release, if Agent has not met with him prior to release
Recess: 11:13 am

Defendant's Notice of Hearings for the 9/24/14 Pretrial Conference, 10/3/14 Status Conference & 10/10/10 Preliminary Hearing

Mailed to: 200 E. Truman St., Rom 102 Jefferson, WI 53549
Returned by USPS: Return to Sender/Not deliverable as addressed/unable to forward
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Cases 14CF178, 14CF202 & 14CF332 called together at 8:40 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court, in-custody, with Attorney Robert W. Buckett. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF332:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Caughlin waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
 
As to all cases: Atty Buckett: Did have offer on earlier cases, but with new charges, that offer has now been revoked. Will informally pre-try matter with ADA Beck and request matter be set for anticipated plea/sentencing. 
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:44 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing for 10/31/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 10:40 am.

Judge Weston presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:39pm. [Clerk: MK]
Defendant William R Caughlin appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived to the date of 10/10/14.

The Court requires a $1,000 cash bond, with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with Tanya Wolff
--not to be present at the Hilltop Hotel in Jefferson
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 1:44pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/24/14 at 10:40am  (2) schedule Status Conference on 10/3/14 at 1:30pm. (3) also schedule Preliminary Hearing on 10/10/14 at 8:30am.
